greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimum m such that n*2^m+k is prime, for k < 2^m. In other words, assuming you've read n out of a binary stream, a(n) is the minimum number of additional bits (appended to the least significant end of n) you must read before it is possible to obtain a prime.
comment: Somewhat related to the Riesel problem, A040081, the minimum m such that n*2^m-1 is prime.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
example: a(12) = 3 because 12 = 1100 in binary and 97 = 1100001 is the first prime that starts with 1100, needing 3 extra bits.
program: (PARI) A108234(n) = { my(m=0,k=0); while(!isprime((n*2^m)+k), k=k+1; if(2^m==k, k=0; m=m+1)); m; }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 16 2017, after Octave/MATLAB code
results.author: _Mike Stay_, Jun 16 2005
